remarks: A finite sum expressed in terms of a partial sum of an infinite series. The recursive definition of follows as ~ fsum1 and ~ fsump1i , which should make our notation clear and from which, along with closure ~ fsumcl , we will derive the basic properties of finite sums. (Contributed by NM, 11-Dec-2005.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 21-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fsumser.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> ( F ` k ) = A ) $.
fsumser.2 $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( ZZ>= ` M ) ) $.
fsumser.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. ( M ... N ) ) -> A e. CC ) $.
fsumser $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. ( M ... N ) A = ( seq M ( + , F ) ` N ) ) $.
$d F k $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
$d k ph $.
